metadata.title: CVE-2017-5122 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Inappropriate use of table size handling in V8 in Google Chrome prior to61.0.3163.100 for Windows allowed a remote attacker to triggerout-of-bounds access via a crafted HTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5122` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 61.0.3163.100-0ubuntu0.16.04.1306
chromium-browser-l10n - 61.0.3163.100-0ubuntu0.16.04.1306
chromium-chromedriver - 61.0.3163.100-0ubuntu0.16.04.1306
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 61.0.3163.100-0ubuntu0.16.04.1306
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 61.0.3163.100-0ubuntu0.16.04.1306
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '61.0.3163.100-0ubuntu0.16.04.1306').
oxide-qt: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'Ubuntu touch end-of-life').
libv8-3.14: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'libv8 not supported').
